transcript.text: Shalom this is daniel john lee with to
our restoration ministries it is January
the 4th 2016 evening of January the 24th
as we're getting toward the end of the
tenth hebrew month Gunther really tough
lasts several days because on Wednesday
night I suddenly learned from my dad
that his younger sister one of his
younger sisters my Aunt Emily she passed
away rather suddenly on Wednesday night
and she was only 55 she was very young
very healthy for most of her life except
that in May of this year she was
diagnosed with kidney cancer just in one
of her kidneys so they wound up removing
her kidney along with some other lymph
nodes to excise the cancer from her and
you know we thought things were going to
be good unfortunately by the time they
removed it she was so advanced that the
cancer had spread and it spread to her
lungs but even spreading into her lungs
you know she still had a 50-50 chance of
survival but over the course of the
summer the cancer unfortunately spread
into her bones and once it gets into
your bones it's it's very difficult to
recover although you know I was praying
for her constantly and I I believe that
she was really going to overcome that
she was gonna beat this thing just
because of how young she is and she's a
very strong bold woman and them but
unfortunately on Sunday night she she
was rushed to the hospital and over the
coerced to the next few days her organs
began shutting down her eyes remain
dilated for I think 12 hours and she was
basically brained at at that point so
they took her off life support and she
passed away wednesday night out of all
my brother my dad had
he's one of six siblings and out of all
the aunts and uncles that I that I know
I was closest to my Aunt Emily just
because my dad would take us to visit
her quite a bit because for quite a
number of years during my childhood she
was single she didn't get married till
later and so she was always free to to
get together with us and I I remember
visiting her quite often because she
didn't live that far from my
grandparents and my dad would always
take us to visit my grandparents every
year up in Ohio and so I have a lot of
memories of my Aunt Emily and just like
the title suggests I'm very
brokenhearted at at losing her very sad
I really loved her a lot I remember even
when I was a senior in high school 17 18
years old I had a number of phone
conversations with her and I talked to
her I'm just sharing different things in
my life ups and downs and I remember
always feeling very close and connected
with her i remember when i went for a
family reunion i hung out a lot with her
and then also when my grandpa died in
1996 during my senior year I also met
remember spending quite a bit of time
with her but she was a very strong very
beautiful woman very vivacious I felt
like I had a lot in common with her and
as I was reading her obituary that her
husband wrote for her I found to my
delight that she and her husband hosted
a Passover Seder a while back which i
think is really neat because I didn't
know anyone else in my family was sort
of interested in the Hebrew roots of the
faith until I read this and Emily's
obituary and that that really was
special and meant a lot to me she was a
devout Catholic but she was very giving
she was always giving to people always
praying for people even when she got
sick this last spring she was constantly
praying and stuff and I had quite a bit
of communication with her by text and
email while she was sick trying to give
her some information about
her cancer but I know that she loved
yeah I know that her heart was pure and
I know that she's resting in in Yahshua
and that I will see her again in the
future they made a video memorial video
for her that went live today on the
internet and it just made me weep when I
washed it today and uh just really sad
really broken harder to lose her other
than losing my grandma and grandfather
this is really the closest person I've
ever lost and really it's a really
experienced a lot of heart brokenness
over this a lot of sadness just because
I guess it just shocked me I really
thought she was going to overcome I I
spent quite a bit of time talking to my
dad a couple days ago and just telling
him how shocked I was and he seemed to
actually be doing better than me because
he sort of expected it but it's hard for
him to because this is the first time
that some was dyed close to him that's
younger than him having his emily is
about I think she he said 15 16 17 years
younger than himself so she's only the
second oldest of the six siblings and 55
is too young to die anyway but I hold on
to the hope that I will see her on the
Feast of Trumpets sometime in the future
when the last trumpet is blown really
missed her a lot and I know that grief
and sadness is good i know that it
refines the heart but i really miss her
a lot
and I can't wait to see her again Shalom
Shalom
